item.title: About
item.description: I am a first-year Ph.D. student in the Graduate School of Advanced Mathematical Sciences at Meiji University. I also work as a Research Associate in the School of Interdisciplinary Mathematical Sciences. My research revolves around complex systems, exploring topics ranging from social dynamics to mathematical biology. I use tools from statistical physics, mathematics, and computation to uncover the fundamental principles underlying a diverse array of phenomena.
